meanings.definition: A metal fastener with a helical ridge, used to join objects together by being rotated.
meanings.sent1: I needed screws to fix the loose shelf in my room.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used screws to secure the wooden planks together.
meanings.sent3: Why did the screws refuse to hold the shelf up? They must be on strike!
meanings.sent4: The screws of friendship hold us together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The shiny screws gleamed under the bright light of the workshop.

meanings.definition: To tighten or fasten with a screw.
meanings.sent1: He carefully screws the lid onto the jar to keep the cookies fresh.
meanings.sent2: She screws the bulb into the lamp socket to light up the room.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chef screw up the recipe by adding too much salt?
meanings.sent4: The storm screws the waves into a frenzy, crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent5: She screws her face into a frown when she hears the bad news.

meanings.sent1: The screws patrol the prison corridors to ensure security.
meanings.sent2: The new screws were trained on how to handle the inmates.
meanings.sent3: Why did the screws play hide-and-seek with the prisoners? It's not their job!
meanings.sent4: The screws keep a watchful eye on the inmates, ready to intervene if needed.
meanings.sent5: The clinking of keys announces the arrival of the screws for their shift.
